headshotImage.longCaption: Gerald Coetzee, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Rovman Powell b Coetzee 46 (49b 2x4 3x6) SR: 93.87

dismissalComment.html: chopped on, and Powell yells his frustration out! He looked to pull that short ball away, but seemed to have been late on the shot. The ball was short and outside off, as he swung his bat, only for the ball to take the bottom edge and hit leg stump. I guess it was bowled with a scrambled seam from Coetzee to try and deceive Powell. And despite that, the ball seemed to have good bounce

image.longCaption: Shamarh Brooks player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Shamarh Brooks player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamarh Brooks player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Coetzee strikes in his second over in ODI cricket and celebrates with a big roar. The length is short enough for cut, but the line is closer to off, cramping Brooks for room. He can only drag it back onto his own stumps

headshotImage.caption: Nicholas Pooran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nicholas Pooran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Coetzee returns to the attack and takes out Pooran. Back of a length and outside off, the ball isn't coming onto the bat. Pooran still goes for the pull and drags it to Rassie at midwicket off the bottom half of the bat. That snaps a good stand between Pooran and Hope

headshotImage.caption: Bjorn Fortuin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Bjorn Fortuin player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Mayers player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Mayers player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Fortuin strikes with his third ball. He has Mayers holing out to deep midwicket. This is a half-tracker on off stump, Mayers jumps back and pulls flat and hard to Rickelton at deep midwicket. Mayers didn't get enough elevation to clear the debutant at the boundary. He drags himself off the field

headshotImage.caption: Brandon King player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brandon King player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Fortuin has yorked King. Three quick strikes from SA. Wide on the crease, slider, King jabs his bat down, but the ball sneaks under it and pings off stump. The off bail gets tipped off

dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder lbw b Shamsi 15 (20b 1x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Holder dares to reverse-sweep from the stumps, but ends up wafting it into the leg side off the glove or off the arm. Tossed up and turning in Is Holder out arm before the wicket? SA ask for a review. Ultra Edge indicates that it missed the bat. Ball-tracking indicates that it would have hit the stumps. Good review from SA. Umpire Erasmus' on-field not-out decision has been reversed. De Kock is chuffed as Shamsi marks his return with a wicket

headshotImage.longCaption: Marco Jansen, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Akeal Hosein lbw b Jansen 2 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: inswinging yorker from left-arm over. Hosein is late to bring his bat down. Given out lbw WI have two reviews left and Hosein wants to use one. Jags in to ping him on the front foot/boot. No bat involved. Ball-tracking indicates that it would've crashed into leg stump. Akeal was perhaps sent ahead of Odean to target left-arm spinner Shamsi but he has now fallen to the left-arm seamer

dismissalText.commentary: Odean Smith b Shamsi 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Shamsi castles Odean. On a length and breaks away, Odean doesn't pick the wrong'un. He plays for the stock ball, but this one goes the other way to hit the top of off stump. Odean was aiming to dink it into the leg side but does not lay bat/pad on ball in the end

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Temba Bavuma c †Hope b Joseph 144 (118b 11x4 7x6) SR: 122.03

dismissalComment.html: gloved down the leg side! Bavuma walks back after raising South Africa's hopes. And he gets a pat on the back from a few West Indies players. What a great fight when there was virtually nothing to play for. A slower ball - like a cutter - banged short on off, and getting it to angle down leg by Joseph. Bavuma went for the pull, but the ball bounced slightly higher and took Bavuma's glove to end into Hope's gloves, as the keeper moved to his left

headshotImage.longCaption: Q de Kock headshot

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Mayers player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Mayers player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock lbw b Mayers 48 (26b 5x4 3x6) SR: 184.61

dismissalComment.html: given out leg before, but de Kock reviews. Mayers bowled with a scrambled seam, angling it in off a good length from around the wicket. De Kock looked to defend, as the ball hit his back leg - just above the knee - after sliding past his inside edge. There is no inside edge, and replays show the ball would have clipped the top of leg stump, while returning umpire's call. He survived a review just last over, but this time it goes West Indies' way

headshotImage.caption: Akeal Hosein player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Akeal Hosein player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him. Clips the middle stump! de Zorzi is annoyed, but Hope is pumped up. There was turn after it pitched full on off, and was fired quicker and flatter. De Zorzi seemed to head down the track but ended up losing balance, as much as getting beaten by the flatter trajectory and the greater pace. Hosein ends a steady stand, and keeps West Indies floating

headshotImage.caption: Marco Jansen, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Marco Jansen, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: Hosein has Jansen holing out to long-on. Jansen gives Hosein the charge. The left-arm fingerspinner holds this back just a shade outside off, has Jansen checking his shot and chipping it to Powell. Regulation catch. SA wobble around Bavuma's steady ton

headshotImage.caption: Bjorn Fortuin player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Bjorn Fortuin player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Dangled up outside off, dips and turns away past the outside edge, leaving Fortuin overbalanced. Hope gathers the ball cleanly and takes the bails off in a flash. Hope and Hosein think they have their man. Yes, Fortuin is out stumped. The side-on angle confirms that the foot is on the line when the bails are dislodged. No part of the foot behind the crease. Key double-strike from Hosein. He is a smart white-ball bowler

image.caption: Rassie van der Dussen portrait
image.longCaption: Rassie van der Dussen portrait, November 19, 2020

headshotImage.caption: Rassie van der Dussen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rassie van der Dussen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: nabbed at fine leg! VDD runs out of luck after twice surviving in the last over. Good bouncer by Joseph. VDD never looked comfortable against the short ball during his stay, and falls to it eventually. Joseph continued banging it short to VDD, and getting good bounce too. This one climbed on to middle and off while angling in, as VDD pulled with his front leg in the air. But the ball took the top edge, and landed exactly where the fielder was stationed, which was a good few steps inside the boundary

headshotImage.caption: Temba Bavuma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Temba Bavuma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gloved down the leg side! Bavuma walks back after raising South Africa's hopes. And he gets a pat on the back from a few West Indies players. What a great fight when there was virtually nothing to play for. A slower ball - like a cutter - banged short on off, and getting it to angle down leg by Joseph. Bavuma went for the pull, but the ball bounced slightly higher and took Bavuma's glove to end into Hope's gloves, as the keeper moved to his left

headshotImage.caption: Tabraiz Shamsi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tabraiz Shamsi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: edged, and taken by Hope again! West Indies wrap this one up after a few hiccups, and go 1-0 up in the series. Shamsi went driving at this length ball, which angled away, with Joseph offering the No. 11 something to have a go at. Shamsi fell for it, and ended up getting an outside edge after reaching out for the ball, with Hope taking it lowish to his right.

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan Rickelton lbw b Cariah 14 (16b 0x4 1x6) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Cariah strikes first ball. Umpire Erasmus raises his finger. Rickelton chats with Bavuma and seems like they've reviewed rather reluctantly. Lovely legbreak, nice and full, turns in fairly quickly to beat the inside edge and thud into the pad in front of off and middle. UltraEdge detects a flat line. According to the ball-tracker, it would've crashed into middle

dismissalText.commentary: Tristan Stubbs c †Hope b Smith 6 (10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: a simple catch for Hope moving across to his left! Change of pace from Smith, and this one seemed to have stuck in the pitch while keeping low too. Smith bowled short around off, as Stubbs pulled perhaps expecting the ball to bounce a lot more while also coming on to the bat nicely. But the ball ballooned off the top edge, and Hope came a few steps down to gobble it

dismissalText.commentary: Bjorn Fortuin st †Hope b Hosein 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Dangled up outside off, dips and turns away past the outside edge, leaving Fortuin overbalanced. Hope gathers the ball cleanly and takes the bails off in a flash. Hope and Hosein think they have their man. Yes, Fortuin is out stumped. The side-on angle confirms that the foot is on the line when the bails are dislodged. No part of the foot behind the crease. Key double-strike from Hosein. He is a smart white-ball bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Temba Bavuma c †Hope b Joseph 144 (118b 11x4 7x6) SR: 122.03

dismissalComment.html: gloved down the leg side! Bavuma walks back after raising South Africa's hopes. And he gets a pat on the back from a few West Indies players. What a great fight when there was virtually nothing to play for. A slower ball - like a cutter - banged short on off, and getting it to angle down leg by Joseph. Bavuma went for the pull, but the ball bounced slightly higher and took Bavuma's glove to end into Hope's gloves, as the keeper moved to his left

dismissalComment.html: edged, and taken by Hope again! West Indies wrap this one up after a few hiccups, and go 1-0 up in the series. Shamsi went driving at this length ball, which angled away, with Joseph offering the No. 11 something to have a go at. Shamsi fell for it, and ended up getting an outside edge after reaching out for the ball, with Hope taking it lowish to his right.

dismissalText.commentary: Tabraiz Shamsi c †Hope b Joseph 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

commentPreTextItems.html: "@Celine looks like you are responsible indeed" --- Thanks, Sak

commentTextItems.html: edged, and taken by Hope again! West Indies wrap this one up after a few hiccups, and go 1-0 up in the series. Shamsi went driving at this length ball, which angled away, with Joseph offering the No. 11 something to have a go at. Shamsi fell for it, and ended up getting an outside edge after reaching out for the ball, with Hope taking it lowish to his right.

commentPostTextItems.html: South Africa fell 48 short despite as many as 50 balls remaining. Bavuma started hitting as soon as de Kock - who smashed 48 from 26 balls fell - and kept going until the end, perhaps hinting at his new-found approach. There was no real contribution otherwise, as this match brought back memories of this ODI between South Africa and England in 2009, not least because the South Africa captains on the day got similar scores. Anyway, we bid goodbye to you until the series decider after this excellent start to the series. Goodnight from Deiva, Raghav, and me, Himanshu!

West Indies captain Shai Hope is the Player of the Match: "Temba played a brilliant innings, but catches win matches. We put ourselves under pressure... It was important for us to focus on what was ahead of us. I thought it was a difficult to start on. Once you get in, you've got to go big. You have to play the situation... Credit must go to the batting partners to make it easy for me. Brilliant start to the series"

Temba Bavuma speaks first: "Lungi and I just said to each other that you never know what can happen... If we had restricted them to around 300 considering we had got early wickets. There is nowhere else to learn... this is valuable experience. This is all about learning. We kept believing, and taking it ball by ball. Definitely not Anrich [for the third ODI]."
Kevin: "That's the most I've ever seen Joseph celebrate a wicket!"

8.56pm A day for the two captains, although only one of them would be a happy man. A shame really that Bavuma ended up on the wrong side despite a scintillating fight worth 144 - his highest ODI score - off only 118 balls. One of those days when you give everything you have, but things still don't fall in place. He could only watch, as the hosts lost 6 for 54 in a dramatic middle-order collapse. Bavuma's opposite number Hope hit 128* himself, as West Indies posted 335 - their best against South Africa in this format - and finished the day as the winner. Hang around for the presentations after this great contest.

dismissalText.commentary: Rovman Powell b Coetzee 46 (49b 2x4 3x6) SR: 93.87

dismissalComment.html: chopped on, and Powell yells his frustration out! He looked to pull that short ball away, but seemed to have been late on the shot. The ball was short and outside off, as he swung his bat, only for the ball to take the bottom edge and hit leg stump. I guess it was bowled with a scrambled seam from Coetzee to try and deceive Powell. And despite that, the ball seemed to have good bounce

dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder lbw b Shamsi 15 (20b 1x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Holder dares to reverse-sweep from the stumps, but ends up wafting it into the leg side off the glove or off the arm. Tossed up and turning in Is Holder out arm before the wicket? SA ask for a review. Ultra Edge indicates that it missed the bat. Ball-tracking indicates that it would have hit the stumps. Good review from SA. Umpire Erasmus' on-field not-out decision has been reversed. De Kock is chuffed as Shamsi marks his return with a wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mayers c Rickelton b Fortuin 36 (26b 5x4 2x6) SR: 138.46

dismissalComment.html: Fortuin strikes with his third ball. He has Mayers holing out to deep midwicket. This is a half-tracker on off stump, Mayers jumps back and pulls flat and hard to Rickelton at deep midwicket. Mayers didn't get enough elevation to clear the debutant at the boundary. He drags himself off the field

dismissalText.commentary: Shamarh Brooks b Coetzee 0 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Coetzee strikes in his second over in ODI cricket and celebrates with a big roar. The length is short enough for cut, but the line is closer to off, cramping Brooks for room. He can only drag it back onto his own stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Brandon King b Fortuin 30 (29b 4x4 0x6) SR: 103.44

dismissalComment.html: Fortuin has yorked King. Three quick strikes from SA. Wide on the crease, slider, King jabs his bat down, but the ball sneaks under it and pings off stump. The off bail gets tipped off

dismissalText.long: c van der Dussen b Coetzee
dismissalText.commentary: Nicholas Pooran c van der Dussen b Coetzee 39 (41b 5x4 0x6) SR: 95.12

dismissalComment.html: Coetzee returns to the attack and takes out Pooran. Back of a length and outside off, the ball isn't coming onto the bat. Pooran still goes for the pull and drags it to Rassie at midwicket off the bottom half of the bat. That snaps a good stand between Pooran and Hope

dismissalText.commentary: Rovman Powell b Coetzee 46 (49b 2x4 3x6) SR: 93.87

dismissalComment.html: chopped on, and Powell yells his frustration out! He looked to pull that short ball away, but seemed to have been late on the shot. The ball was short and outside off, as he swung his bat, only for the ball to take the bottom edge and hit leg stump. I guess it was bowled with a scrambled seam from Coetzee to try and deceive Powell. And despite that, the ball seemed to have good bounce

dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder lbw b Shamsi 15 (20b 1x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Holder dares to reverse-sweep from the stumps, but ends up wafting it into the leg side off the glove or off the arm. Tossed up and turning in Is Holder out arm before the wicket? SA ask for a review. Ultra Edge indicates that it missed the bat. Ball-tracking indicates that it would have hit the stumps. Good review from SA. Umpire Erasmus' on-field not-out decision has been reversed. De Kock is chuffed as Shamsi marks his return with a wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Akeal Hosein lbw b Jansen 2 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: inswinging yorker from left-arm over. Hosein is late to bring his bat down. Given out lbw WI have two reviews left and Hosein wants to use one. Jags in to ping him on the front foot/boot. No bat involved. Ball-tracking indicates that it would've crashed into leg stump. Akeal was perhaps sent ahead of Odean to target left-arm spinner Shamsi but he has now fallen to the left-arm seamer

dismissalText.commentary: Odean Smith b Shamsi 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Shamsi castles Odean. On a length and breaks away, Odean doesn't pick the wrong'un. He plays for the stock ball, but this one goes the other way to hit the top of off stump. Odean was aiming to dink it into the leg side but does not lay bat/pad on ball in the end

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock lbw b Mayers 48 (26b 5x4 3x6) SR: 184.61

dismissalComment.html: given out leg before, but de Kock reviews. Mayers bowled with a scrambled seam, angling it in off a good length from around the wicket. De Kock looked to defend, as the ball hit his back leg - just above the knee - after sliding past his inside edge. There is no inside edge, and replays show the ball would have clipped the top of leg stump, while returning umpire's call. He survived a review just last over, but this time it goes West Indies' way

dismissalText.commentary: Temba Bavuma c †Hope b Joseph 144 (118b 11x4 7x6) SR: 122.03

dismissalComment.html: gloved down the leg side! Bavuma walks back after raising South Africa's hopes. And he gets a pat on the back from a few West Indies players. What a great fight when there was virtually nothing to play for. A slower ball - like a cutter - banged short on off, and getting it to angle down leg by Joseph. Bavuma went for the pull, but the ball bounced slightly higher and took Bavuma's glove to end into Hope's gloves, as the keeper moved to his left

headshotImage.longCaption: Yannic Cariah, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan Rickelton lbw b Cariah 14 (16b 0x4 1x6) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Cariah strikes first ball. Umpire Erasmus raises his finger. Rickelton chats with Bavuma and seems like they've reviewed rather reluctantly. Lovely legbreak, nice and full, turns in fairly quickly to beat the inside edge and thud into the pad in front of off and middle. UltraEdge detects a flat line. According to the ball-tracker, it would've crashed into middle

headshotImage.caption: Akeal Hosein player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Akeal Hosein player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tony de Zorzi b Hosein 27 (26b 4x4 0x6) SR: 103.84

dismissalComment.html: bowled him. Clips the middle stump! de Zorzi is annoyed, but Hope is pumped up. There was turn after it pitched full on off, and was fired quicker and flatter. De Zorzi seemed to head down the track but ended up losing balance, as much as getting beaten by the flatter trajectory and the greater pace. Hosein ends a steady stand, and keeps West Indies floating

dismissalText.commentary: Rassie van der Dussen c Brooks b Joseph 8 (11b 1x4 0x6) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: nabbed at fine leg! VDD runs out of luck after twice surviving in the last over. Good bouncer by Joseph. VDD never looked comfortable against the short ball during his stay, and falls to it eventually. Joseph continued banging it short to VDD, and getting good bounce too. This one climbed on to middle and off while angling in, as VDD pulled with his front leg in the air. But the ball took the top edge, and landed exactly where the fielder was stationed, which was a good few steps inside the boundary

dismissalText.commentary: Tristan Stubbs c †Hope b Smith 6 (10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: a simple catch for Hope moving across to his left! Change of pace from Smith, and this one seemed to have stuck in the pitch while keeping low too. Smith bowled short around off, as Stubbs pulled perhaps expecting the ball to bounce a lot more while also coming on to the bat nicely. But the ball ballooned off the top edge, and Hope came a few steps down to gobble it

dismissalText.commentary: Bjorn Fortuin st †Hope b Hosein 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Dangled up outside off, dips and turns away past the outside edge, leaving Fortuin overbalanced. Hope gathers the ball cleanly and takes the bails off in a flash. Hope and Hosein think they have their man. Yes, Fortuin is out stumped. The side-on angle confirms that the foot is on the line when the bails are dislodged. No part of the foot behind the crease. Key double-strike from Hosein. He is a smart white-ball bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Gerald Coetzee run out (Hosein/Smith) 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: slower offcutter, Bavuma shuffles across and glances through square leg for a risky double. Coetzee could be out here. He hasn't slid the bat inside the crease. Nice, flat throw from Hosein. WI close in on victory. Why did Bavuma even go for the second last ball?

dismissalText.commentary: Tabraiz Shamsi c †Hope b Joseph 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: edged, and taken by Hope again! West Indies wrap this one up after a few hiccups, and go 1-0 up in the series. Shamsi went driving at this length ball, which angled away, with Joseph offering the No. 11 something to have a go at. Shamsi fell for it, and ended up getting an outside edge after reaching out for the ball, with Hope taking it lowish to his right.

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Mayers player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Mayers player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock lbw b Mayers 48 (26b 5x4 3x6) SR: 184.61

dismissalComment.html: given out leg before, but de Kock reviews. Mayers bowled with a scrambled seam, angling it in off a good length from around the wicket. De Kock looked to defend, as the ball hit his back leg - just above the knee - after sliding past his inside edge. There is no inside edge, and replays show the ball would have clipped the top of leg stump, while returning umpire's call. He survived a review just last over, but this time it goes West Indies' way

headshotImage.longCaption: Yannic Cariah, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan Rickelton lbw b Cariah 14 (16b 0x4 1x6) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: Cariah strikes first ball. Umpire Erasmus raises his finger. Rickelton chats with Bavuma and seems like they've reviewed rather reluctantly. Lovely legbreak, nice and full, turns in fairly quickly to beat the inside edge and thud into the pad in front of off and middle. UltraEdge detects a flat line. According to the ball-tracker, it would've crashed into middle

headshotImage.caption: Akeal Hosein player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Akeal Hosein player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tony de Zorzi b Hosein 27 (26b 4x4 0x6) SR: 103.84

dismissalComment.html: bowled him. Clips the middle stump! de Zorzi is annoyed, but Hope is pumped up. There was turn after it pitched full on off, and was fired quicker and flatter. De Zorzi seemed to head down the track but ended up losing balance, as much as getting beaten by the flatter trajectory and the greater pace. Hosein ends a steady stand, and keeps West Indies floating

dismissalText.commentary: Rassie van der Dussen c Brooks b Joseph 8 (11b 1x4 0x6) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: nabbed at fine leg! VDD runs out of luck after twice surviving in the last over. Good bouncer by Joseph. VDD never looked comfortable against the short ball during his stay, and falls to it eventually. Joseph continued banging it short to VDD, and getting good bounce too. This one climbed on to middle and off while angling in, as VDD pulled with his front leg in the air. But the ball took the top edge, and landed exactly where the fielder was stationed, which was a good few steps inside the boundary

dismissalText.commentary: Tristan Stubbs c †Hope b Smith 6 (10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: a simple catch for Hope moving across to his left! Change of pace from Smith, and this one seemed to have stuck in the pitch while keeping low too. Smith bowled short around off, as Stubbs pulled perhaps expecting the ball to bounce a lot more while also coming on to the bat nicely. But the ball ballooned off the top edge, and Hope came a few steps down to gobble it

dismissalText.commentary: Marco Jansen c Powell b Hosein 17 (14b 3x4 0x6) SR: 121.42

dismissalComment.html: Hosein has Jansen holing out to long-on. Jansen gives Hosein the charge. The left-arm fingerspinner holds this back just a shade outside off, has Jansen checking his shot and chipping it to Powell. Regulation catch. SA wobble around Bavuma's steady ton

dismissalText.commentary: Bjorn Fortuin st †Hope b Hosein 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Dangled up outside off, dips and turns away past the outside edge, leaving Fortuin overbalanced. Hope gathers the ball cleanly and takes the bails off in a flash. Hope and Hosein think they have their man. Yes, Fortuin is out stumped. The side-on angle confirms that the foot is on the line when the bails are dislodged. No part of the foot behind the crease. Key double-strike from Hosein. He is a smart white-ball bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Gerald Coetzee run out (Hosein/Smith) 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: slower offcutter, Bavuma shuffles across and glances through square leg for a risky double. Coetzee could be out here. He hasn't slid the bat inside the crease. Nice, flat throw from Hosein. WI close in on victory. Why did Bavuma even go for the second last ball?

dismissalText.commentary: Temba Bavuma c †Hope b Joseph 144 (118b 11x4 7x6) SR: 122.03

dismissalComment.html: gloved down the leg side! Bavuma walks back after raising South Africa's hopes. And he gets a pat on the back from a few West Indies players. What a great fight when there was virtually nothing to play for. A slower ball - like a cutter - banged short on off, and getting it to angle down leg by Joseph. Bavuma went for the pull, but the ball bounced slightly higher and took Bavuma's glove to end into Hope's gloves, as the keeper moved to his left

dismissalText.commentary: Tabraiz Shamsi c †Hope b Joseph 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: edged, and taken by Hope again! West Indies wrap this one up after a few hiccups, and go 1-0 up in the series. Shamsi went driving at this length ball, which angled away, with Joseph offering the No. 11 something to have a go at. Shamsi fell for it, and ended up getting an outside edge after reaching out for the ball, with Hope taking it lowish to his right.
